info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:42PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Moffat County through 515 PM MDT... At 442 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Craig, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Craig. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 76 and 89. Colorado 13 between mile markers 91 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
